alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 10:05PM MDT until March 31 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions are expected Friday afternoon through early evening... .The combination of northwest winds gusting up to 45 mph and relative humidity readings falling below 15 percent will create Critical fire weather conditions in the Red Flag Warning area. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 254... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 7 PM MDT Friday. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. * Timing...Noon MDT through 7 PM MDT Friday. * Winds...Northwest 30 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 14 percent. * Temperatures...In the mid 50s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
